org.jcvi.jillion.sam.index

Interface ReferenceIndex


  • public interface ReferenceIndex
    ReferenceIndex is an object representations of a BAM index file's list of bins and linear intervals used for indexing.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two ReferenceIndexes are equal if they have the same Bins and the same intervals.
      List<Bin> getBins()
      Get an unmodifiable List of Bins in this reference.
      VirtualFileOffset getHighestEndOffset()
      Get the optional metadata field which contains the highest end VirtualFileOffset that references this reference.
      VirtualFileOffset[] getIntervals()
      Get (defensive copy of) the array of intervals for this index.
      VirtualFileOffset getLowestStartOffset()
      Get the optional metadata field which contains the lowest begin VirtualFileOffset that references this reference.
      Long getNumberOfAlignedReads()
      Get the optional metadata field which contains the number of aligned reads in this reference.
      int getNumberOfBins()
      Get the number of Bins in this reference.
      Long getNumberOfUnAlignedReads()
      Get the optional metadata field which contains the number of unaligned reads in this reference.
      boolean hasMetaData()
      Does this ReferenceIndex contain optional metadata? Some implementations of BAM indexes include metadata that is not in the BAM index specification.

    • Method Detail

      • getBins

        List<Bin> getBins()
        Get an unmodifiable List of Bins in this reference.
        Returns:
        a List of Bins, will never be null but may be empty.

      • getIntervals

        VirtualFileOffset[] getIntervals()
        Get (defensive copy of) the array of intervals for this index.
        Returns:
        an array of VirtualFileOffsets, which will never be empty, although there might be null cells in the array.

      • hasMetaData

        boolean hasMetaData()
        Does this ReferenceIndex contain optional metadata? Some implementations of BAM indexes include metadata that is not in the BAM index specification.
        Returns:
        true if getNumberOfAlignedReads(), getNumberOfUnAlignedReads(), getLowestStartOffset() and getHighestEndOffset() all return non-null values; false otherwise.

      • getNumberOfUnAlignedReads

        Long getNumberOfUnAlignedReads()
        Get the optional metadata field which contains the number of unaligned reads in this reference.
        Returns:
        null if this reference does not have metadata; otherwise a long.
        See Also:
        hasMetaData()

      • getNumberOfAlignedReads

        Long getNumberOfAlignedReads()
        Get the optional metadata field which contains the number of aligned reads in this reference.
        Returns:
        null if this reference does not have metadata; otherwise a long.
        See Also:
        hasMetaData()

      • getLowestStartOffset

        VirtualFileOffset getLowestStartOffset()
        Get the optional metadata field which contains the lowest begin VirtualFileOffset that references this reference.
        Returns:
        null if this reference does not have metadata; otherwise a VirtualFileOffset.
        See Also:
        hasMetaData()

      • getHighestEndOffset

        VirtualFileOffset getHighestEndOffset()
        Get the optional metadata field which contains the highest end VirtualFileOffset that references this reference.
        Returns:
        null if this reference does not have metadata; otherwise a VirtualFileOffset.
        See Also:
        hasMetaData()

      • getNumberOfBins

        int getNumberOfBins()
        Get the number of Bins in this reference. This is the same as getBins().size()
        Returns:
        an int will always be >=0.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two ReferenceIndexes are equal if they have the same Bins and the same intervals.
        Note Since the metadata fields are optional, they do not count towards equality checks.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
